page.title: 16FOREST OF DEAN: USES OF AREA
page.content: THERE ARE FEW RIGHTS OF WAY, BUT THE FORESTRY COMMISSION ALLOW THE PUBLIC ACCESS TO MOST AREAS. THEY PROVIDE WAY MARKED PATHS WITH EXPLANATORY LEAFLETS AND LET THE RAMBERS' ASSOCIATION WAY MARK A LONG DISTANCE PATH. THEY PROVIDE PICNIC SITES, TOILETS, BAR-B-QUES, AND CAR PARKS. THE CAR PARK AT CANNOP BEING LAID OUT IN SMALL BAYS AMONGST TREES. THE ROYAL AUTOMOBILE CLUB CAR RALLY USES FOREST TRACKS AND THE AREA IS ALSO USED FOR ARMY TRAINING. THE NORTH GLOUCESTERSHIRE ORIENTEERING CLUB HAS MEETINGS HERE. FIELDS BY SPEECH HOUSE ARE USED BY A CRICKET CLUB AND PONY & RIDING CLUBS. SOME PEOPLE USE THE CUSTOM OF GRAZING SHEEP ON UNENCLOSED LAND.
